But some of us know that Top Secret is not the top security classification.  There are FIVE MORE LEVELS ABOVE TOP SECRET.  Such documents are kept in thick-steel-walled vaults.  You cannot remove Above Top Secret documents from the vault.  The President has to go to the Pentagon where the vault is.  Any document that could get Trump executed for treason is in one of those vaults.

Now, Kurtz, YOU are trying to make it sound like Trump hiding documents was the impetus all along.  No, it is a desperate attempt to salvage a smart-aleck strategy.  The affidavit cannot be fully revealed because doing so would likely cause monstrous EMBARASSMENT to the Biden administration that the impetus was the alleged nuclear weapons document.  How could Biden and Garland NOT KNOW that a nuclear weapons document cannot leave the Pentagon vault, therefore Trump never had one in the White House to move to his own home?

But on Tuesday night, the Justice Department used a routine court filing in the matter to initiate a blistering counteroffensive that disclosed new evidence that Trump and his legal team may have interfered with the inquiry.
Sign up for The Morning newsletter from the New York Times
In the filing, in U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Florida, department officials revealed more details about the classified materials that Trump had taken from the White House, including a remarkable photograph of several of them arrayed on the floor of Mar-a-Lago, his home and private club in Florida. In what read at times like a road map for a potential prosecution down the road, the filing also laid out evidence that Trump and his lawyers may have obstructed justice.
It was as if Trump, seeming not to fully grasp the potential hazards of his modest legal move, cracked open a door, allowing the Justice Department to push past him and seize the initiative.
‚ÄúThe Trump team got more than they bargained for,‚Äù said Preet Bharara, a former U.S. attorney in Manhattan and a longtime critic of Trump. ‚ÄúIn response to a thin and tardy special master motion, DOJ was given the opportunity to be expansive.‚Äù
